labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is an AI Development Platform focused on enhancing collaboration between AI assistants and human developers. Its core functionality includes managing development projects by providing context, automating task management, and facilitating real-time progress tracking. The available tools enable features like context retrieval, task assignment, progress updates, and discussion creation, all within a development workflow.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around enhancing the development process, including project management and collaboration between developers and AI. Secondary labels "AI/ML Tools" and "Daily Productivity" are included because the server heavily uses AI/ML capabilities and aids in productivity through task automation. A custom label is not necessary as the predefined labels effectively cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Buildable AI Development Platform
server_info_crawled.author: @chunkydotdev/bldbl-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to seamlessly integrate with your development projects by providing full project context, autonomous task management, and real-time progress tracking. Collaborate effectively with AI and human developers to accelerate project delivery and maintain clear communication. Manage tasks, track progress, and create discussions effortlessly within your AI-powered development workflow.

tools.name: get_project_context
tools.description: Deploy Server Buildable AI Development Platform @chunkydotdev/bldbl-mcp Try in Playground get_project_context

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@chunkydotdev/bldbl-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
